item.title: By: himansu sekher das

item.description:
hey it should be either IF @EMP_INS = 'NULL' or simply IF @EMP_INS IS NULL, but how can you use assignment operator as well as is keyword?
all d best himansu 09853436485
item.content:encoded:
hey it should be either IF @EMP_INS = ‘NULL’ or simply IF @EMP_INS IS NULL, but how can you use assignment operator as well as is keyword?

all d best
himansu

item.title: By: gunjan rathore
item.dc:creator: gunjan rathore
item.description:
joseph i am not able to insert the value in the table please help me code is as follow:
CREATE PROC EMPDTL_INPU
( @EMP_INS VARCHAR(12), @EMP_ID INT, @FNAME VARCHAR(20), @LNAME VARCHAR(20), @SEX CHAR(1), @C_NUMBER VARCHAR(20), @EMAIL_ID VARCHAR(20), @ADDRESS VARCHAR(20), @ZIP VARCHAR(20) )
AS
@EMP_INS = (select @EMP_ID = EMP_ID from EMP_DTL where EMP_ID ='@EMP_ID')
CHECK = @EMP_INS
IF @EMP_INS = IS NULL
THEN
BEGIN
Insert into EMP_DTL(EMP_ID, FNAME, LNAME, SEX, C_NUMBER, EMAIL_ID, ADDRESS, ZIP) VALUES(@EMP_ID, @FNAME, @LNAME, @SEX, @C_NUMBER, @EMAIL_ID, @ADDRESS, @ZIP)
END IF
update EMP_DTL set EMP_ID = @EMP_ID, FNAME = @FNAME, LNAME = @LNAME, SEX = @SEX, C_NUMBER = @C_NUMBER, EMAIL_ID= @ EMAIL_ID, ADDRESS = @ADDRESS, ZIP = @ZIP where EMP_ID = @EMP_ID
END
item.content:encoded:
joseph i am not able to insert the value in the table please help me code is as follow:

CREATE PROC EMPDTL_INPU

( @EMP_INS VARCHAR(12), @EMP_ID INT, @FNAME VARCHAR(20), @LNAME VARCHAR(20), @SEX CHAR(1), @C_NUMBER VARCHAR(20), @EMAIL_ID VARCHAR(20), @ADDRESS VARCHAR(20), @ZIP VARCHAR(20) )

AS

@EMP_INS = (select @EMP_ID = EMP_ID from EMP_DTL where EMP_ID =’@EMP_ID’)

CHECK = @EMP_INS

IF @EMP_INS = IS NULL

THEN

BEGIN

Insert into EMP_DTL(EMP_ID, FNAME, LNAME, SEX, C_NUMBER, EMAIL_ID, ADDRESS, ZIP)
VALUES(@EMP_ID, @FNAME, @LNAME, @SEX, @C_NUMBER, @EMAIL_ID, @ADDRESS, @ZIP)

END IF

update EMP_DTL
set
EMP_ID = @EMP_ID, FNAME = @FNAME, LNAME = @LNAME, SEX = @SEX, C_NUMBER = @C_NUMBER, EMAIL_ID= @ EMAIL_ID, ADDRESS = @ADDRESS, ZIP = @ZIP
where EMP_ID = @EMP_ID

END

item.title: By: Jim
item.dc:creator: Jim
item.description: Dude, your blog comes to the rescue once again (I hope)! I'm having trouble with PHP on Neptune not wanting to talk to the database. I totally missed the FreeTDS settings, among other things you mentioned here. I should probably start documenting things this way myself.
item.content:encoded: Dude, your blog comes to the rescue once again (I hope)! I’m having trouble with PHP on Neptune not wanting to talk to the database. I totally missed the FreeTDS settings, among other things you mentioned here. I should probably start documenting things this way myself.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott’s Blog » SQL Server 2000: Maximum Row Size 8060 Bytes
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott’s Blog » SQL Server 2000: Maximum Row Size 8060 Bytes
item.description: [...] I’ve been reasonably happy with SQL Server 2000, especially after I got it working with PHP from FreeBSD. Today though, I ran into something that I was surprised to see in SQL Server, there is a maximum row size of 8060 bytes. I was disappointed that Microsoft’s current production database system would still have this kind of limitation. [...]
item.content:encoded: […] I’ve been reasonably happy with SQL Server 2000, especially after I got it working with PHP from FreeBSD. Today though, I ran into something that I was surprised to see in SQL Server, there is a maximum row size of 8060 bytes. I was disappointed that Microsoft’s current production database system would still have this kind of limitation. […]
